com.yantra.api.wms.move

Interface createMoveRequest

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface createMoveRequest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createMoveRequest(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      createMoveRequest provides ability to create a move request.

    • Method Detail

      • createMoveRequest

        org.w3c.dom.Document createMoveRequest(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException

        createMoveRequest provides ability to create a move request. Whenever there is a need to move products or containers within the 4 walls of a DC, move request may be created. Multiple departments (called as from activity group) within the warehouse may log these requests with the inventory department. These requests may be for putting away or retrieving inventory satisfying a criterion.
        Move request is created with the following behavior:

        • Status :- 'CREATED'.
        • HasExceptions:- 'N'.
        • ReasonCode:- BLANK.
        • ReasonText:- BLANK.

        Status audit corresponding to the move request is created with the following data:
        • OldStatus:- BLANK.
        • NewStatus:- 'CREATED'.
        • OldStatusDate:- Current DB Date.
        • NewStatusDate:- Current DB Date.

        For the move request, each move request line is created with the following behavior:
        • ReleasedFlag:- 'N'.
        • CancelledFlag:- 'N'.
        • HasExceptions:- 'N'.
        • ReasonCode:- BLANK.
        • ReasonText:- BLANK.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSBeforeCreateMoveRequestUE

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction CREATE_MOVE_REQUEST.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of modifyMoveRequest.
            Data published - WMS_CREATE_MOVE_REQUEST.ON_SUCCESS.xml

        Audits:
        A status audit corresponding to Move Request is created with the following values in the YFS_Move_Request_Status_Audit table:

        • OldStatus:- BLANK.
        • NewStatus:- 'CREATED'.
        • OldStatusDate:- Current DB Date.
        • NewStatusDate:- Current DB Date.

        Pre Conditions:
      • Environment handle obtained using createEnvironment() API must be available with the calling program.
      • Move request being created should not already be existing in the database

        • Post Conditions:
        Output XML for create move request is generated. A record for request gets created.

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains the details of the move request created. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
